text: Samsung has been talking about
its foldable display technology for years,

and now we're finally
gonna get a first look

at its first foldable
smartphone, the Galaxy Fold.
The phone will cost nearly $2,000
when it launches on April 26.
Let's take a look at what's inside.
Whoa! So here we have it.
This is finally it: the Galaxy Fold.

It really does look like
a tablet. It's 7.3 inches.
Just about the same size,
it's a bit smaller than an iPad mini.
And this is kind of what it looks like
when you're in the process of folding it.
There's this hinge, this little crease
that forms along the middle.

So when it's folded, it does
feel a little bit thick,
and I think what surprised me the most
just taking this out of the box
is how long it is for a phone.

It's still easy to use with
one hand, and that screen

is a bit small compared
to most smartphones.

But when you open it up
and use it in tablet mode,
it feels really light for a tablet.

The Galaxy Fold also
comes with a case as well,

and this is really important
because, since the phone
is so unique and has such a rare design,
I imagine it's not going to be that easy
to find a case for it,
so Samsung includes one in the box.
So we have three cameras right here,

that you'll find on the Galaxy S10.

They're completely wireless.

in with the Galaxy Fold.

charger right here,

The adapter that goes

compared to most smartphones,
